abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the China Second Jiangxi
            Highway Project were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory,
            the risk to development outcome was low or negligible, the
            Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: 1) closer review of designs and technical
            specifications are required; 2) it is important to ensure
            that the Bank teams regularly visit the site; 3) improve the
            planning and design of interchanges and interconnecting
            roads; 4) the activities of foreign supervision consultants
            needs to be carefully designed so as to ensure they add
            value to the project; and 5) need to continue pressing
            solutions to the overloading problem.

5086280.trustfund:
TF040412-CHINA:  SECOND JIANGXI HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS,TF038822-CHINA - PREPARATION O FJAIANGXI
            II, II AND INNER MONGOLIA

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Jiangxi Highway Project aims
            at providing more efficient, and safe transport
            infrastructure in support of social, and economic
            development in the Province. The components will: 1) expand
            highway capacity through the construction of the
            Taihe-Ganzhou Expressway (TGE), partly traversing
            mountainous areas, to serve Ganzhou, the province second
            largest city, and, substantially reduce travel distances to
            Guangdong Province. TGE construction includes tunnels,
            interconnecting roads, toll stations, and service/rest
            areas, as well as equipment supply. Furthermore, a
            management, and maintenance center, and monitoring centers
            will be included, in addition to electrical/mechanical
            facilities for telecommunications, lighting, and monitoring
            activities; 2) include a road improvement program, designed
            to help people in poor counties, increase their income,
            through better access to product markets, employment
            opportunities, social services, and facilities. This program
            will improve forty roads sections, and eight selected
            sections located in four counties. Performance indicators
            include average daily traffic, availability, and cost of bus
            services, number of days the road is closed/non-available,
            number of school children, number of people visiting
            hospitals/clinics, and, increases/decreases in the County
            per capita income; 3) enable highway safety, through safety
            measures at roadwork sites, safety audit checklists, and a
            pilot project to identify hazardous locations; and, 4)
            restructure institutional framework to adapt to the changing
            economic, and competitive environment in China. It includes
            studies on organizational changes, supply of equipment, and,
            related training programs. Land acquisition will take place,
            thus resettlement issues are further discussed in the
            Resettlement Action Plan.

437372.trustfund:
TF038822-CHINA - PREPARATION O FJAIANGXI
            II, II AND INNER MONGOLIA,TF040412-CHINA:  SECOND JIANGXI HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND

repnme.cdata!:
China - Second Jianxi Highway Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Second Jiangxi Highway Project for China, which improves
            four rural roads. These are some of the negative
            environmental impacts and their proposed mitigations. Land
            subject to plant removal will have vegetation restored,
            including a greenbelt set up along roadsides. Drainage works
            will include ditches to prevent soil erosion, run-off,
            floods, and interference with irrigation. Earth borrowing
            and waste disposal will comport with design requirements and
            topsoil will be reclaimed and restored. Dumped earth will be
            arranged and compressed in tight layers according to the
            height of the retaining wall. Construction during the rainy
            season will avoid the rainy season. Oil from vehicles and
            construction machines will be collected and disposed of in a
            landfill. Soundproofing windows will reduce noise. Noise at
            construction sites will be controlled by restricting time
            and place of activity, and by consulting residents who will
            be impacted when necessary and compensating them. Workers
            themselves will wear protective helmets and ear-plugs. Dump
            sites quarries, and mixing plants will be located beyond
            residential areas, material covered when hauled, and sites
            sprayed in order to minimize dust.

            landfill. Soundproofing windows will reduce noise. Noise at
            construction sites will be controlled by restricting time
            and place of activity, and by consulting residents who will
            be impacted when necessary and compensating them. Workers
            themselves will wear protective helmets and ear-plugs. Dump
            sites quarries, and mixing plants will be located beyond
            residential areas, material covered when hauled, and sites
            sprayed in order to minimize dust.

888066.trustfund:
TF038822-CHINA - PREPARATION O FJAIANGXI
            II, II AND INNER MONGOLIA,TF040412-CHINA:  SECOND JIANGXI HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND

repnme.cdata!:
China - Second Jianxi Highway Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Second Jiangxi Highway Project for China, which improves
            four rural roads. These are some of the negative
            environmental impacts and their proposed mitigations. Land
            subject to plant removal will have vegetation restored,
            including a greenbelt set up along roadsides. Drainage works
            will include ditches to prevent soil erosion, run-off,
            floods, and interference with irrigation. Earth borrowing
            and waste disposal will comport with design requirements and
            topsoil will be reclaimed and restored. Dumped earth will be
            arranged and compressed in tight layers according to the
            height of the retaining wall. Construction during the rainy
            season will avoid the rainy season. Oil from vehicles and
            construction machines will be collected and disposed of in a
            landfill. Soundproofing windows will reduce noise. Noise at
            construction sites will be controlled by restricting time
            and place of activity, and by consulting residents who will
            be impacted when necessary and compensating them. Workers
            themselves will wear protective helmets and ear-plugs. Dump
            sites quarries, and mixing plants will be located beyond
            residential areas, material covered when hauled, and sites
            sprayed in order to minimize dust.
